contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox French commune |name = Fruges |image coat of arms = Blason Fruges.svg |region = [[Nord-Pas-de-Calais]] |department = [[Pas-de-Calais]] |arrondissement = [[arrondissement of Montreuil-sur-Mer|Montreuil]] |canton = Fruges |INSEE = 62364 |postal code = 62310 |mayor = Jean-Jacques Hilmoine |term = 2001–2008 |intercommunality = [[Communauté de communes du Canton de Fruges et environs]] |longitude = 2.1344 |latitude = 50.5153 |elevation m = 107 |elevation min m = 84 |elevation max m = 171 |area km2 = 18.9 |population = 2426 |population date = 1999 }} '''Fruges''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Pas-de-Calais]] [[Departments of France|department]] in the [[Nord-Pas-de-Calais]] region of [[France]]. ==Geography== Situated some 12 miles (19 km) northeast of [[Montreuil-sur-Mer]] on the D928 road, set in a valley not far from the historic battlefield of [[Battle of Agincourt|Azincourt]]. ==Features== Fruges is a typical small country town in the [[Pas-de-Calais]] with a weekly market, agricultural suppliers, a [[Carrefour]] and various smaller stores. An annual ''Fête des Géants'' livens up August with parades of marching bands and ''papier mache'' giants. ==Population== {{Demography |1962 = 2421 |1968 = 2460 |1975 = 2534 |1982 = 2465 |1990 = 2499 |1999 = 2426 |withoutdoublecount = 1962 }} ==Places of interest== * Church of St. Bertulphe, dating from the nineteenth century. ==Twin towns== Fruges is twinned with [[Olsberg, Germany|Olsberg]], [[Germany]], since 1965. ==See also== *[[Communes of the Pas-de-Calais department]] ==References== * [http://www.insee.fr/fr/methodes/nomenclatures/cog/fichecommunale.asp?codedep=62&codecom=364 INSEE commune file] {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.quid.fr/communes.html?mode=detail&id=26858&req=Fruges Fruges on the Quid website] {{Fr}} {{Pas-de-Calais communes}} [[Category:Communes of Pas-de-Calais]] {{PasdeCalais-geo-stub}}
